alert.note: Alert for Perry (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 03 at 3:57PM EDT until May 03 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR NORTH CENTRAL PERRY COUNTY WILL EXPIRE AT 400 PM EDT... The storm which prompted the warning has weakened below severe limits, and has exited the warned area. Therefore, the warning will be allowed to expire. However small hail, gusty winds and heavy rain are still possible from other thunderstorms trailing behind. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southeastern Ohio. Repetitive torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service Charleston West Virginia.
